text: If the Module editor in the IDE shows "no errors found" but then I am trying to view the Preview and nothing loads (I just get a blank white screen), is there any easy way to diagnose what the problem is? As is I don't know if it's issue with my code or are there issues with the preview mode on HubSpot's side?

The module editor’s error checker only checks for syntax errors and variables that dont exist, and functions that are deprecated, that kind of thing. If you for example accidentally code an if statement  that’s supposed to be based on a boolean field wrong it could always be true or always be false regardless of the value of the input field. The IDE would not find any errors in it. been there done that.
I never use preview mode, alwasys have a testl ayout
does it work outside of preview <@U26C29XPH>
I second using a test template/page as Remmington said. The preview currently has a few issues which make it inaccurate given the right circumstances.
Yeah I dropped it into an email that I am working on and I can at least see what's not working specifically with it, rather than not seeing ANYTHING like the Previewer.
Anyone had issues being able to select the checkboxes next to the items in the Filter Tags dropdown? I'm not able to select any of them.

Also, how are we suppose to be using the new Page Selector? I copied the snippet into the module and put it in an a href but it doesn't look to actually be printing a URL. Instead it's printing this as the link: ```<http://page%20200189497%20hiring%20an%20inbound%20marketing%20agency/>```
